tier_1_determinative.person_voluntarily_causes_hurt: Yes, it is alleged that the applicant and co-accused voluntarily caused hurt to the complainant.
tier_1_determinative.in_committing_or_attempting_robbery: Yes, the hurt was caused during the alleged robbery of a mobile phone, although the phone was immediately returned.

tier_2_material.injury_severity: The injury report indicates that the complainant suffered simple injuries.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: In front of Vaibhav Palace Society, Near Mega Mall, Link Road, Jogeshwari (W), Mumbai.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Ashish Shamsher Vaid vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Mr. S. H. Yadav, APP for State
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 394, 326, 324, 323, 504, 506 read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860

residual_details.additional_facts: The co-accused has been granted regular bail by the trial Court. The applicant is 21 years of age with no criminal antecedents. The vastara used in the assault has already been recovered.

template_label: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery (IPC 394)
